creator: paul.tinsley@hcahealthcare.com
text:
If I use --enable-modules and put ssl in the list like so:
./configure --with-modules="auth-ldap log-config env mime-magic expires headers 
ssl static-support static-htpasswd static-htdigest static-rotatelogs static-
logresolve http mime status autoindex info suexec cgi alias rewrite so" --
prefix=/usr/local/apache

mod_ssl.c doesn't come up in the list of modules from httpd -l

if I change that configure line to:
./configure --with-modules="auth-ldap log-config env mime-magic expires headers 
ssl static-support static-htpasswd static-htdigest static-rotatelogs static-
logresolve http mime status autoindex info suexec cgi alias rewrite so" --
prefix=/usr/local/apache --enable-ssl

It does show up after compile.  It seems that using ssl in the module list 
doesn't seem to work.  I don't know if this is a documentation issue and 
shouldn't work or a configure script error and should work.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
I don't see where --with-modules is listed as a way to specify modules.
I believe you should be using --enable-modules=...

Or is this a typo in your bug report?

Ugh, thats what I get for trying to compile something when tired.  VERY sorry 
about this one!  Completely my fault and sorry to waist your time, but it does 
bring up a question… should configure complain when you pass it options that 
don't exist to help mitigate typos?
creator: paul.tinsley@hcahealthcare.com
slive@apache.org
text:
I agree, and yours is not the first bug report cause by this flaw, but it
seems that because of the way apache needs to pass configure options to
the various sub-programs/libraries involved in the build, there is no
way to check the syntax on the configure command line.
